sentences.en: A subservient client would soon face an accumulation of ever - growing pressures.
sentences.cn: 奴颜婢膝的附庸则很快就会导致外来日益增加的种种压力.

sentences.en: He hated heing subservient to this dean.
sentences.cn: 处于比院长低一截的地位,实在让他厌恶.

sentences.en: He is subservient to his boss.
He's totally subservient to his boss.
Her willingness to be subservient to her children isolated her.
sentences.cn: 她对她的孩子们顺从的意愿使她陷于孤立。

sentences.en: Innumerable subservient heroes were appealed to compete for it.
sentences.cn: 无数拜倒石榴的英雄都为了它被吸引来竞争.
这张美丽的脸上总是带着那样的表情:顺受的,毫不抱怨, 毫不诉苦的.

sentences.en: People should not be regarded as subservient to the economic system.
sentences.cn: 不应把人的因素看成是经济体制的附庸.

sentences.en: She has become submissive and subservient.
She is expected to be subservient to her uncle.
sentences.cn: 她被要求对叔叔恭敬顺从。

sentences.en: The majority of men must be subservient to the machine.
sentences.cn: 大多数人不能不从属于机器.

sentences.en: The woman's needs are seen as subservient to the group interest.
sentences.cn: 妇女的需求被认为要服从团体的利益。

sentences.en: The women of the south are diminutive, subservient and very polite.
sentences.cn: 南方的妇女娇小可爱, 毕恭毕敬,很有礼貌.

sentences.en: They were shifty , cheerful , subservient men.
sentences.cn: 他们都属于这类人:随机应变,欢欢喜喜,善于奉承.

words.tran_cn: 屈从的；奉承的；有用的；有帮助的

trans.tran_cn: 卑躬屈节的，有帮助的，充当下手的，马屁精
trans.tran_en: always obeying another person and doing everything they want you to do – used when someone seems too weak and powerless
